snippet: Bailouts were necessary in 2008 to keep the financial system operating, but it is now more important than ever to distinguish why that was important.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column holds that bank bailouts were necessary in 2008 to keep the financial system operating, but it is now more important than ever to distinguish why that was important; suggests that JPMorgan Chase's long list of legal problems since then contain examples of bad things that can stem from activities outside traditional commercial banking.
